page.title: 01Saughall
page.content:
Saughall dates back to Anglo-Saxon times.The name{'Saughall'}means {"Corner Where Willows Grow"}.Around 1280 Saughall was a major fishing port,supplying fish to other villages.
One of the most famous inhabitants was{Mary Davies or "The Horned Woman {Of Chester"}as she was known,because of the horns she grew behind her ears.
The village,which is dominated by the Vernon Institute,is a mixture of modern housing estates,council houses and Tudor cottages.
The Vernon Institute dates back to Tudor times and a clock tower was erected in memory of T.J.Vernon when he died in 1919 .
